docs.abstract: Bernie Sanders and Joseph R. Biden Jr. have been seeking to take control of the race in its early stages, trying to deny momentum to their top two rivals, Elizabeth Warren and Pete Buttigieg.
docs.snippet: Bernie Sanders and Joseph R. Biden Jr. have been seeking to take control of the race in its early stages, trying to deny momentum to their top two rivals, Elizabeth Warren and Pete Buttigieg.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., two front-runners in the Democratic presidential race, are mounting a late push to gain a decisive advantage in the early primary and caucus states, aiming to avert a monthslong delegate battle against two insurgent rivals — and each other.

headline.main: Sanders and Biden Look for Dominance in Early States
headline.print_headline: Biden and Sanders Seek Chance  To Make a Break From the Pack

byline.original: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

docs.abstract: It was a ritual on my journey through The Times’s list of 52 Places to Go to send a postcard home from each destination. Now that I’m back, they’re a collage of my memories.
docs.snippet: It was a ritual on my journey through The Times’s list of 52 Places to Go to send a postcard home from each destination. Now that I’m back, they’re a collage of my memories.
docs.lead_paragraph: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

headline.main: The Little Tastes of Normalcy on a Trip Around the World

docs.abstract: The Democratic presidential candidate said he would spend big even if the nominee was someone he had sharp differences with, like Bernie Sanders or Elizabeth Warren.
docs.snippet: The Democratic presidential candidate said he would spend big even if the nominee was someone he had sharp differences with, like Bernie Sanders or Elizabeth Warren.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN MARCOS, Texas — Michael R. Bloomberg on Saturday did not rule out spending a billion dollars of his own money on the 2020 presidential race, even if he does not win the Democratic nomination, and said he would mobilize his well-financed political operation to help Bernie Sanders or Elizabeth Warren win in November if either is the party nominee, despite their sharp policy differences.

headline.main: Michael Bloomberg Is Open to Spending $1 Billion to Defeat Trump
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Vows to Spend $1 Billion to Defeat Trump

docs.abstract: The Community Reinvestment Act needs a renovation. The Trump administration instead is proposing a partial demolition.
docs.snippet: The Community Reinvestment Act needs a renovation. The Trump administration instead is proposing a partial demolition.
docs.lead_paragraph: Banks don’t like lending in lower-income neighborhoods, even as they profit from deposits taken from those same communities. Since 1977, the Community Reinvestment Act has forced the issue, requiring banks to provide mortgages, small-business loans and other services in all areas where they operate.

headline.main: Changing Rules to Help Bankers and Hurt Poor Neighborhoods
headline.print_headline: Helping Banks and Hurting the Poor

docs.abstract: The astronomer missed her Nobel Prize. But she now has a whole new observatory to her name.
docs.snippet: The astronomer missed her Nobel Prize. But she now has a whole new observatory to her name.
docs.lead_paragraph: Vera Rubin, a young astronomer at the Carnegie Institution in Washington, was on the run in the 1970s when she overturned the universe.

headline.main: Vera Rubin Gets a Telescope of Her Own
headline.print_headline: Observatory Is Named  For Dark Matter Pioneer

docs.abstract: The downing of an airliner near Tehran, apparently by an Iranian missile, has created a diplomatic crisis.
docs.snippet: The downing of an airliner near Tehran, apparently by an Iranian missile, has created a diplomatic crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like most Canadians, when I saw the first bulletins about a jetliner going down near Tehran’s airport, I had no inkling that the tragedy would reach Canada in a significant way. But it has been hard felt, particularly in Edmonton, from where I’m writing this week’s Canada Letter.

headline.main: A Distant Missile Strike Spreads Grief Across Canada

docs.abstract: The latest movie in the “John Wick” saga airs on HBO, and the Raconteurs perform songs off their new album on “Austin City Limits.”
docs.snippet: The latest movie in the “John Wick” saga airs on HBO, and the Raconteurs perform songs off their new album on “Austin City Limits.”
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN WICK: CHAPTER 3 — PARABELLUM (2019) 8 p.m. on HBO; stream on HBO platforms. At just over two hours, this over-the-top action flick is propelled forward mostly by a series of impeccably choreographed fight scenes. It is the third installment in the “John Wick” franchise by the returning director Chad Stahelski, and it picks up where the second film left off. John (Keanu Reeves) has been excommunicated from the High Table, the global society of villains to which he once belonged, and has a multimillion-dollar bounty on his head. Suddenly there’s a killer on every corner. Knowing he’s outnumbered, John heads to Morocco in hopes of revoking his death sentence. Along the way he seeks help from his former mentor (Anjelica Huston) and a friend from his past (Halle Berry), who has a couple of merciless dogs trained for combat. Writing in The New York Times, Jeannette Catsoulis said that the movie’s endless cycle of violence can become deadening, but its elaborate thrills give it its edge.

headline.main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘John Wick: Chapter 3’ and ‘Austin City Limits’

docs.abstract: In a rare public filing, the bureau said it would extend wiretap changes to other tools for collecting data on suspected spies and terrorists.
docs.snippet: In a rare public filing, the bureau said it would extend wiretap changes to other tools for collecting data on suspected spies and terrorists.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A chastened F.B.I. told a secretive court on Friday that it was increasing training and oversight for officials who work on national security wiretap applications in response to problems uncovered by a scathing inspector general report last month about botched surveillance targeting a former Trump campaign adviser.

headline.main: F.B.I. Apologizes to Court for Botching Surveillance of Trump Adviser, and Pledges Fixes
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Pledges Fixes to Wiretap Requests
